abstract: Critics of Comcast's proposed acquisition of Time Warner Cable are urging regulators to examine how well company has fulfilled commitments as part of its deal to acquire NBC Universal, like Internet Essentials program, which they say is public relations stunt; program, which Comcast said would give 2.5 million low-income households cheap broadband service, has fallen far short of that goal.
lead_paragraph: Critics of the proposed merger with Time Warner Cable say that Comcast’s attitude toward compliance paints a picture of an already huge company that uses its heft to its advantage.

headline.main: Comcast Critics Cast Doubt on Its Intentions
headline.print_headline: Comcast Critics Cast Doubt on Its Intentions

snippet: Critics of the proposed merger with Time Warner Cable say that Comcast’s attitude toward compliance paints a picture of an already huge company that uses its heft to its advantage.
